Bitcoin and Market Structure Explained


Market structure is the foundation of Bitcoin price action.
In bullish phases, $BTC forms higher highs and higher lows.
In bearish phases, price prints lower highs and lower lows.


Indicators like moving averages, RSI, MACD, and Fibonacci help confirm structure but do not replace price action.


Recognizing trend shifts and consolidation phases allows traders to manage risk and time entries more effectively.

The "Linux of Finance": Vitalik Buterin‚Äôs 2026 Ethereum Manifesto üèóÔ∏è While $BTC  has successfully cemented itself as digital gold, Vitalik Buterin is shifting the Ethereum narrative toward "Civilizational Infrastructure." In his latest 2026 roadmap, Vitalik argues that Ethereum's true value isn't in being a flashy startup, but in becoming a neutral, "boring" foundation for the global internet.  The Blueprint for Institutional Trust:    ‚Ä¢ The BitTorrent Model: Vitalik compares Ethereum to BitTorrent a system that scales through pure peer-to-peer coordination without a central server. With the recent launch of PeerDAS, Ethereum is now proving this scale can coexist with decentralized consensus.   ‚Ä¢ The Linux Standard: By mirroring the Linux model, Ethereum aims to be the open-source layer that enterprises and governments trust because no single entity owns it. It is built to pass the "Walkaway Test" applications must keep running even if their original developers disappear.   ‚Ä¢ Solving the Trilemma: Earlier this week, Vitalik stated the Trilemma is no longer a theory. With zkEVMs and PeerDAS moving into production, Ethereum is the first network to achieve high bandwidth, security, and decentralization simultaneously.  If Ethereum follows this path, adoption won't be a loud marketing event. It will be a quiet, deep integration into the global financial and social fabric becoming as indispensable (and as hard to replace) as the internet itself. üåê  #ETH  #VitalikButerin  #Web3  #MacroInsights  #InstitutionalCrypto

#Bitcoin #BTC #BTCUSDT

I went all the way back to 2017 and studied all the different relief rallies. Not only the major ones post ATH, 2018 and 2022, but also the intermediary ones. I focused on shape, size and duration. Bitcoin is relief rally friendly.

After a sharp drop, if the general market bias is bearish, Bitcoin tends to produce a relief rally before resuming with its bearish trend.

These relief rallies tend to happen within 10-50 days after the drop with one exception. There was one instance where it took almost two months for a relief rally to fully unravel. Normally, these tend to show up much faster.

These relief rallies fluctuate in size from a nice 35% to some 60-80%. They tend to be big. So far, in 2026, our present relief rally peaked at 17%. Meaning, there is plenty of room left for additional growth.

It's been 49 days since the 21-November low. This time window also indicates that a higher high can develop within days. Can be 3-5 days.

A double-top came-in 5-January (vs 9-December). After four days red, Bitcoin's price remains strong. All the signals short-term came out as neutral. A neutral signal favors whatever was happening before the signal showed up. Bitcoin has been rising since 21-November 2025 so we have a bullish bias. This bias continues intact.

If Bitcoin drops below $90,000 before moving ahead, this should be considered a "extreme buy opportunity." Buy everything you can with high lev.

Conclusion: Bitcoin is bullish and will continue rising.

Hal Finney's early faith and contributions (despite later battling ALS until his passing in 2014) remain foundational ‚Äì a true pioneer who believed in decentralized money when almost no one else did. How does Bitcoin Mining Work?  Bitcoin mining consists of solving cryptographic hash problems to add new blocks of transactions to the Bitcoin blockchain and earn $BTC .  Below is how BTC mining works:  1/ Transactions are grouped into blocks: When someone sends or receives BTC, pending transactions are grouped into a ‚Äúblock‚Äù waiting to be confirmed.  2/ Miners solve a puzzle: Miners use computers to guess a special number, called the nonce, that, when combined with the block data, produces a result below a specific target number. It is like a digital lottery ticket that involves a puzzle.  3/ Adding to the blockchain: The first miner to solve the puzzle gets to add their block to the blockchain. Other miners check this block to make sure it is valid.  4/ Earning rewards: The winning miner earns bitcoin, which includes newly created BTC and transaction fees from the block they mined.  #Bitcoin  #BTC

The technical setup combined with the halving catalyst presents one of the highest-conviction long-term plays in crypto markets.

The U.S. Senate Banking Committee is scheduled to vote on the Crypto B $BTC Market Structure Bill
(CLARITY Act) on January 15 - a decision that could fundamentally reshape how crypto markets operate in the United States.
The CLARITY Act is designed to address one core issue: market integrity. Its goal is to reduce manipulation and introduce enforceable transparency standards across crypto trading venues.
The bill would introduce several key measures:
Ban wash trading and artificial volume inflation
Criminalize spoofing and front-running
Grant regulators real-time monitoring tools to detect market abuse
Require proof-of-reserves and regular audits for U.S.-based exchanges
January 15 may mark a turning point for the next phase of crypto market development.

In some regions, mining has also contributed to lowering methane emissions and supporting the transition away from fossil-based energy systems. These developments suggest  $BTC mining is gradually evolving toward a more energy-efficient and environmentally integrated model.

BitMEX Research says the October  $BTC crash marked a turning point for the market. The long period of "easy yield" -where low volatility and strong institutional demand made simple strategies profitable - has ended.

Liquidity has declined, risk profiles have worsened, and passive approaches no longer work. Investors are shifting toward staking as baseline yield, but APR alone is no longer enough - infrastructure quality, smart-contract risk, and protocol resilience now matter.

BitMEX concludes the market has entered a new cycle where returns depend on active strategies, deeper analysis, and higher discipline, not market tailwinds.
